word_mean: 牙：颌部用于咀嚼食物的一副坚硬小结构，亦指其他动、植物中的类似结构。人类的牙齿有两副，即乳牙(暂牙)和恒牙。每颗牙齿都有两个主要部分，即牙冠和牙根，进一步还可分为冠、颈、根、尖四部分。除髓腔外，牙的质地坚硬，主要是由牙质构成。牙冠部披覆一层极为坚硬的无机物釉质，主要在龈线以上部分，埋入颌骨的牙根部则覆有一薄层牙骨质，为真骨组织。髓腔可分为两部分，主要在牙冠内的髓室和通过牙根终于根尖狭孔的髓管(牙根管)。每个牙根至少有一个髓管，即使多根牙也是这样。髓腔中含有牙髓，为由结缔组织、血管和神经构成的软组织。出牙一般是按以下规律发生的：乳牙——第一切牙，6～8月
第二磨牙，20～24月。恒牙——第一磨牙，6～7岁
上颌前后牙剖面示意图：左前牙：A 根尖，AF 根尖孔，SC 附加管，C 牙骨质，PM 牙周膜，PC 髓管，G 牙龈，GC 龈沟，GM 龈缘，PCH 髓腔，D 牙本质，E 牙釉质，CR 牙冠，R 牙根
右后牙：A 根尖，PC 髓管，PCH 髓腔，PH 髓角，F 牙沟，CU 牙尖，CEJ 牙骨质-釉质结合点，BI 牙根分叉
齿，嘴里咀嚼食物的骨性器官。

sentence.Network_en: A dentist may decide to extract the tooth to prevent recurrent trouble.
sentence.Network_cn: 牙医可能会决定拔掉那颗牙，以免反复发作。

sentence.Network_en: When not removed, plaque causes tooth decay and gum disease.
sentence.Network_cn: 牙斑如果不清除就会导致牙齿蛀蚀和牙龈疾病。

sentence.Network_en: He fought tooth and nail to keep his job.
sentence.Network_cn: 他竭尽全力保住自己的工作。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 积极而富成效地工作；专注于

phrase.cizu_name: get (one's) teeth into 或 sink (one's) teeth into &I{【俚语】}

全副地：不缺少任何东西的；全部地

lj.lj_ly: armed to the teeth; dressed to the teeth.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tōth (plural tēth), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch tand and German Zahn, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin dent-, Greek odont-

entry.def: Your teeth are the hard white objects in your mouth, which you use for biting and chewing.

example.ex: She had very pretty straight teeth...
example.tran: 她有一口漂亮整齐的牙齿。

example.ex: If a tooth feels very loose, your dentist may recommend that it's taken out.
example.tran: 如果某颗牙松动得很厉害，牙医会建议把它拔掉。

entry.tran: 齿状物;(梳子、锯、齿轮、拉链等的)齿
entry.def: The teeth of something such as a comb, saw, cog, or zip are the parts that stick out in a row on its edge.

entry.tran: (官方组织、法律等的)威力，效力
entry.def: If you say that something such as an official group or a law has teeth, you mean that it has power and is able to be effective.

example.ex: The opposition argues that the new council will be unconstitutional and without teeth...
example.tran: 反对派争辩说新委员会不但违反宪法，而且没有效力。

example.ex: The law must have teeth, and it must be enforced.
example.tran: 法律必须拥有效力，而且必须强制实施。

entry.def: Someone who is armed to the teeth is armed with a lot of weapons or with very effective weapons.

example.ex: Both sides were armed to the teeth.

entry.tran: 获得初步经验(或训练);起步
entry.def: If you say that someone cut their teeth doing a particular thing, at a particular time, or in a particular place, you mean that that is how, when, or where they began their career and learned some of their skills.

example.ex: ...director John Glen, who cut his teeth on Bond movies...
example.tran: 从邦德电影开始初试牛刀的导演约翰·格伦

example.ex: He cut his teeth in the sixties as director of Edinburgh's Traverse Theatre.
example.tran: 他 60 年代刚出道时在爱丁堡特拉弗斯剧院担任导演。

entry.tran: 使人感到极其不舒服(或恼怒)
entry.def: If you say that something sets your teeth on edge, you mean that you find it extremely unpleasant or irritating.

example.ex: Their voices set your teeth on edge.
example.tran: 他们的声音让你浑身不舒服。

entry.tran: 奋力争取/竭尽全力阻止
entry.def: If you fight tooth and nail to do something, you do everything you can in order to achieve it. If you fight something tooth and nail, you do everything you can in order to prevent it.

example.ex: He fought tooth and nail to keep his job...
example.tran: 他竭尽全力保住自己的工作。

example.ex: Unions pledged to fight any compulsory redundancies 'tooth and nail'.
example.tran: 工会许诺会“竭尽所能地”阻止任何强制裁员。

entry.def: If you describe a task or activity as something you can get your teeth into, you mean that you like it because it is interesting, complex, and makes you think hard.

example.ex: This role gave her something to get her teeth into...
example.tran: 这一角色让她全情投入其中。

example.ex: They have to get involved and get their teeth into some police work.
example.tran: 他们必须参与进来，全力投入到一些警务工作中。

entry.def: If you do something in the teeth of a difficulty or danger, you do it in spite of the difficulty or danger.

example.ex: I was battling my way along the promenade in the teeth of a force ten gale...
example.tran: 我不顾十级大风沿着步行街挣扎前行。

example.ex: In the teeth of the longest recession since the 1930s, the company continues to perform well.
example.tran: 尽管面对 20 世纪 30 年代以来持续时间最长的经济衰退，这家公司却一直经营良好。

entry.tran: 满口谎话;睁着眼说瞎话
entry.def: If you say that someone is lying through their teeth, you are emphasizing that they are telling lies.
If you describe someone as long in the tooth, you are saying unkindly or humorously that they are old or getting old.

example.ex: Aren't I a bit long in the tooth to start being an undergraduate?
example.tran: 我现在才去读大学本科不是有点太老了吗？

entry.def: If you have a sweet tooth, you like sweet food very much.

example.ex: Add more honey if you have a sweet tooth.
example.tran: 如果你喜欢吃甜的就多加点蜂蜜。

means.word_mean: 1. hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; used for biting and chewing or for attack and defense
2. something resembling the tooth of an animal
3. toothlike structure in invertebrates found in the mouth or alimentary canal or on a shell

sentences.sentence: "the treaty had no teeth in it"

means.word_mean: 5. one of a number of uniform projections on a gear

auth_sentence.res_content: We fought for every word, tooth and nail.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We fought for every word, tooth and nail.

auth_sentence.res_content: Ouch, the paranoia and delusions chipped my tooth.

auth_sentence.res_content: He had a gold tooth and a cautious pompadour.

sentences.en: I went to my dentist to have a tooth taken out.
sentences.cn: 我去找牙医拔了一颗牙。

sentences.en: The dentist took out two of my teeth and asked me to come back again to have further treatment.
sentences.cn: 牙医拔掉了我两颗牙, 并让我再来做进一步的治疗。

jushi.english: They are armed to the teeth.
I went to my dentist to have a tooth taken out.
jushi.chinese: 我去找牙医拔了一颗牙。

jushi.english: I've been troubled by a bad tooth.
jushi.chinese: 有颗坏牙一直使我不舒服。
